annotation.TEXT: Still the same broom room...
Well, that's a bust. Not that it matters too much, since I'm short 20 stars anyway, and I think I know where they are.
Isn't that okay?
Oh, I see you've got a full costume.
And with that, Scarlet Devil Mansion is 100% complete! Up next is world 5, which is Hakugyokurou, according to the translation page.
...Oh! But of course! I can use the white duder that's in the left P block down here!
Whoa, I got a little lucky there. And obviously, try to target the smallest Remis first. Having to deal with only 2 micro-Remis at once is far easier than dealing with 16!
Bah. The duder despawned. Okay, I'll just leave this room and return to it to refresh the P blocks.
Dah... I knew I was getting reckless there.
Oh, man! I'm nearly done!
However, now I can't enter the lower-left pipe that I just came out of.
Obviously, do not lose the broom while working your way to the right...
Done! Remilia defeated!
Now, I do remember how this boss works from raocow's playthrough, and it should be obvious enough anyway, for Yoshi's Island fans, at least.
ERGH!!! ...Not quite enough... I'll just try to "ERGH!!!" again.
Of course, if you can hang onto the broom for Remilia, the ability to hover and the extra hit can certainly help.
Ah, there's still even more stars above here. But, if I just barely made it up to this point, then how...?
And now the fight begins for real! Let's do this very carefully, and try get individual micro-Remis isolated from the others so that they can be drill stomped safely...
Or, maybe rooms with power ups. I'll certainly take a broom. Oh, and this reminds me of certain SMB3 bonus rooms.
...Or not!!! Oh, man! Stars in a cross shape! Also, there's still more above!
Next!
And Dracula is the Son of the Dragon, right?
I'm not sure if entering the lower-right pipe twice in a row helped...
Next, DO NOT drill for those 4 stars there yet. Instead, you need to use the bricks they're in as a runway, like this.
Next!
This works consistently for me. BTW, if you screw up once and lose your broom at this point, a perfect is still possible, as long as you don't die.
Also, I just noticed that breakable brick up there. Umm... I can't jump high enough to get up there, though. Is there enough running room to fly anywhere nearby?
Whoa, that was risky. Why did I attack there while they were so close together? Well, I didn't get hit, so that's good.
Aww... It's Remilia, and she's wearing an adorable Rex costume!
Pfft. I tried to duck-fly, but I hit down after taking off by accident there. Is duck-flying even possible in this game? (It is in SMB3 and SMW.)
Still didn't make it. I'm sure it's just barely possible, though.
Gee... I wonder what I should do...
It... took me to the lower-right pipe...
Alright, that's good. Drill stomp time!
Oh, wait. Does that mean I can fly up on the left side of that room?
Hello, and welcome back to Super Marisa World, where I've now broken the 6 million mark on my total score!
Anyway, where's Patchouli?
Anyway, let's try not to just drill stomp recklessly, and target the smallest ones first if possible. I wouldn't want to have to deal with more micro-Remis than necessary.
Who knows? Hm, I haven't seen her lately, have I?
The broom room seems unchanged...
Okay, three-quarters done now. This should gradually get easier as I near the end.
This pre-boss room sure has a lot of Rexes. I wonder if the boss will be Rex-related somehow.
Alright, it's boss time! And yes, the music restarted there because this is where the music actually started in the game. Okay, now let's start off by getting the stars...
Alright, now for those last 20 stars... I've found them, and as I suspected, they're in this room. First, work your way over to the right...
Wait for the Rex's right edge to get here, then duck jump left!
Alright, halfway done!
Yep, Game Over! Okay, I'm going to review my footage and try to figure this place out...
Flawless victory.
Whoa, geez! Okay, I just unlocked a really creepy-looking world 7...
This is because the broom isn't strictly required for anything anymore once you've flown to the upper part of this room. Anyway, there's those 20 stars.
Hmm... Somehow, I doubt I can duck-fly in this game, but if it's possible, let me know!
BGM: Super Marisa Land - Underground
It sounds like your reason is total retcon, but ...
Duck jumping up these stairs seems more effective. Okay, so I'm guessing that the center pipe leads to the boss, and the other pipes lead to rooms with stars...
Alright, let's finish up the Scarlet Devil Mansion by taking on 4-2-4 here!
Okay, those 2 micro-Remis have been dealt with. Now to target the next smallest Remi.
Umm... I hope this doesn't instead take me to the other broom room with dead ends up there...
Okay, now I need to get the perfect, and to do that, I need to locate those last 20 stars, and beat Remi without dying.
Next!
This'll do.
Let's get outta there and head back to world 4.
BTW, there's actually no music playing during this conversation for some reason, so I edited in the boss music, which you normally hear during boss conversations.
Oh! Made it that time!
So, first, enter either of the lower corner pipes twice in a row, and then enter either of the upper corner pipes. This'll take you to the broom room with the stars above.
Doesn't seem like it. Well, I think I've realized how I screwed up, so I'm likely not getting a perfect on this run. So, let's just take on the... boss...?
Yaah!!!
Huh. Just after entering the lower-left pipe, the center pipe becomes unenterable.
Very good.
Yeah, the upper-left pipe goes to the broom room.
Maybe you should be a little worried for her.
To be continued... Ze!
Fortunately, there's no more stars after those. So, make sure you've grabbed all 52 stars in this room.
Next, to reach the ominous music room, enter either lower corner pipe twice in a row, then enter the center pipe.
Actually, let's just try the center pipe now.
Okay, I've got a handle on this place now. (BTW, this footage is at x2 speed in order to make this video fit within 15½ minutes.)
Jump over to the other end of the room (easier with broom hovering) if you need to. This should help get the Remis more spread out.
Yeah, so somehow, I stumbled into an almost-identical broom room that actually does have stuff up above!
Last life. Don't choke now!
Oh, come on... I totally landed on that bigger Remi there...
BGM: Yakety Sax
Center pipe is still useless. However, I'm pretty sure now that this is a case of multiple near-identical rooms, and I'll have to enter pipes in a certain order to get anywhere.
D'oh, I missed!
Hold on, I just thought to try the right side.
HARRY UP!
Oh, there she is!
Yeah, the timer turns an even darker red during the last 10 seconds.
Because vampires are all about Dracula, right?
You're a pretty weak-looking dragon.
GIGA DRILL BREAKER!!!
Nearly there!
BTW, open the broom block first. Otherwise, if the FOE ends up staying on the blocks when you release him, you'll likely kill him when you open the broom block.
Alright, you should have 82 stars going into the boss room, as the last 18 are there.
3 attempts later...
D'oh. Fumbled a bit there. And... now he's stuck. I'm pretty sure I can't just jump through him without losing my broom.
So, I've figured out a consistent way to do this for the harder ones. Move up against the step, and hold down and left. So, you'll be ducking and ready to jump left.
1 attempt later...
No, it's a dead end. That sure seemed like it would be like in SMB3, which have 30 coins hidden up above in the rooms that look like this.
Hey, why are you a dragon, anyway?
Yeah, no music during the conversation. Alright, it's boss time! Obviously, don't start drill stomping Remi until you've gotten all the stars.
Okay, on my previous attempt, I had gotten this far, but I'd used up a lot of time, and decided to just restart before going further, so I could do everything up to here faster.
YES!!!
I assume that pipe leads to the boss, but first, there's four more stars over here.
Okay, now for the really tricky part-- stomping these Rexes in this very narrow space without getting hit.
This keeps going until we get down to really tiny ones that are only half a block tall. At that point, a drill stomp will make that one vanish.
Isn't it really just because the wings matched you?
Yes, just like Marching Milde from Yoshi's Island, drill stomping her causes her to split into two smaller forms. And, I can drill them to split them into even smaller ones!
Well, this is embarrassingly silly. I'm totally gonna time out here, and I haven't refound that other broom room, nor have I figured out how to reach the boss!
Okay, that batch of micro-Remis is gone. I'm halfway done with the fight now.
They're way too close to each other right now. Gotta try to separate them.
Okay, so where am I? This sort of reminds me of the 4-way intersection in Marching Milde's Fort in Yoshi's Island in a way, I think.
Alright, now that I've properly gotten up here with the FOE, I can bounce off of him to reach the highest stars in this room.
Rats. Alright, I'll just go to ludicrous speed until I find the right broom room again or something else happens.
But, beware, as the smaller ones are faster and harder to hit, but they can still easily hit you.
Yes. I'm a western style dragon.
Is that so~
So, I guess you guys will get to see what happens when you time out!
Oh, but now I can enter the lower-right pipe!
D'oh. There were too many micro-Remis too close to each other there.
So, I can normal stomp her safely to reach the high-up stars, but that doesn't actually hurt her.
Then, when the right edge of the Rex is half a block away from the edge of its platform, jump! And then, once you're on top of it, release and repress down to drill stomp.
Nope. Also a dead end. So, it seems that both the upper-right and upper-left pipes link to this same broom room, so I guess I'll try the lower pipes next.
Okay, that was pointless. Okay, now I'll try the lower-left pipe.
Gotta fly even further up for more stars.
And, I can't even go back through the lower-right pipe. Okay, I'm confused now.
